quizzes.question: Why is the "static" value used in positioning?
quizzes.textContent:
[b][h1]Positioning Elements[/h1][/b] The CSS positioning properties allow you to position an element. It can also place an element behind another, and specify what should happen when an element's content is too big. Elements can be positioned using the top, bottom, left, and right properties. However, these properties will not work unless the [b]position [/b]property is set first. They also work differently depending on the positioning method. [h2]Static Positioning[/h2] HTML elements are positioned [b]static [/b]by default. A static positioned element is always positioned according to the normal flow of the page. [b]The HTML:[/b][code format="html" ]

Paragraph with no position.

Paragraph with no position.

Paragraph with no position.

Paragraph with no position.

Paragraph with no position.

This paragraph has a static position.

[/code] [b]The CSS:[/b][code format="css" codeId="567"]p.position_static { [b]position:static;[/b] top: 30px; right: 5px; color: red; }[/code] [b]Result:[/b] [img id="2652" width="100%"] [note]Static positioned elements are not affected by the top, bottom, left, and right properties.[/note]
